title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  1. 1 point: Supply of dollars increases to buy French Franc or to buy French goods.

    (Simply saying "increased supply of dollars" is not acceptable.)

  2. 1 point: Depreciation of U.S. dollar or reduced value of the dollar.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  1. 1 point: Supply of dollars increases to buy French Franc or to buy French goods.

    (Simply saying "increased supply of dollars" is not acceptable.)

  2. 1 point: Depreciation of U.S. dollar or reduced value of the dollar.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  1. 1 point: Supply of dollars increases to buy French Franc or to buy French goods.

    (Simply saying "increased supply of dollars" is not acceptable.)

  2. 1 point: Depreciation of U.S. dollar or reduced value of the dollar.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  1. 1 point: Supply of dollars increases to buy French Franc or to buy French goods.

    (Simply saying "increased supply of dollars" is not acceptable.)

  2. 1 point: Depreciation of U.S. dollar or reduced value of the dollar.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  1. 1 point: Demand for U.S. dollar increases and the dollar appreciates.

    (Simply saying "appreciation of the dollar" is not acceptable.)

  2. 1 point: Quantity supplied of U.S. dollars increases.

  2. 1 point: Quantity supplied of U.S. dollars increases.
